Photo / Mitchell Hageman

Editorial: Kiwi rich-listers call for tax reform - why are political parties afraid of the debate? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/editorial-kiwi-richlisters-call-for-tax-reform-why-are-political-parties-afraid-of-the-debate/DL7TVYBQ5BA4VAXV6FRMNGFJJU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/editorial-kiwi-richlisters-call-for-tax-reform-why-are-political-parties-afraid-of-the-debate/DL7TVYBQ5BA4VAXV6FRMNGFJJU/ OPINION: Bruce Plested this week said he would support a wealth tax - with a catch. Ūawa Horse Sports Club out to raise awareness for riders https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/09/11/uawa-horse-sports-club-out-to-raise-awareness-for-riders/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/09/11/uawa-horse-sports-club-out-to-raise-awareness-for-riders/ Wynsley Wrigley'Pass Wide and Slow' promotes safer driver behaviour towards horse riders on the road. Tue, 10 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Horse lovers like (from left) Uruao Fairlie, Ray Donald and Kahu Donald invite the public to support Ūawa Horse Sports Club's Ūawa Domain to Tolaga Bay Wharf walking, roading and cycling event to support the Pass Wide and Slow NZ (PWASNZ) campaign. The Saturday event starts at 11am. Photo / Paul Rickard
